text: is there a way to change a featured post based on the post tags you click?
If i am creating a template that uses bootstrap 4, should i create a new HTML & HUBL template or a Drag and Drop?

completely up to you <@UHB1CSK33> either way you should provide a fallback for the HS inserted grid so HubSpot modules display correctly,(basically just add the hs grid class names to your bootstrap selectors
ok to override the default classes?

yep, as long as you do it in a way that is somewhat equivalent to what the class is meant for.

for example `.span4` == `.col-sm-4`
ok, if i was just to use the HTML & HUBL template I wouldn't have to do any of this correct?

I think you should create a new HTML & HUBL template because Bootsrtap 4 is based on *Flex property* and HubSpot grid is based on *Float*. If we override it then may be it create some conflicts in future so.

it’s still advisable to do it, HubSpot marketplace modules often use the HS grid classes because it’s expected they atleast function. Also if you don’t do it, you’re just biting yourself in the foot if you ever plan to use the <#CDU990ECW|drag-n-drop-pages> feature

HubSpot has said multiple times they plan to eventually make it so their BS version is not required, and other grid systems could be used. They have no timeline and are still in the experimentation/planning phase of that I think.(it’s a huge undertaking that will require a lot of changes to their code and possibly UI to make it possible.)
it would be nice if there were some bootstrap 4 themes that had all of the modules from bootstrap

Some of us from the community are working on <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft> a framework similar to Bootstrap but built from the ground up to use HubSpot’s unique capabilities. If that’s up your alley, stay tuned(join the channel). We’re going to start making a push to get that project really moving
